Cool haiku by @RedPillReality: Listen; shared secret When we were in a warm womb Sound stirred consciousness
Suddenly awake / to find the waning moon / shining on my pillow @haiku Want to keep that "waning," rising after sunset it gives time sense
Waking suddenly / to find the waning moon / shining on my pillow #haiku, not so 5-7-5 crazy
Waking suddenly / to find the waning half moon's / light on my pillow. -- #haiku
I like this one from @KevlarHeart: Charred keel on scorched sand, / ship that brought me to this shore / so distant from you
Snow-swept morning / Wind shouts around the house / Trees lift their arms and dance -- #haiku. -- Friends, liked yr haikus, see you 1/4/09!
from my dearheart: @SidKemp: Twiggy leggy birch / stand before snowladen pine/ under the blue sky. #haiku
Standing in the snow, sumac/ lifts its cones of scarlet to the sky -- # haiku
1) Winter morning sun / through wall-high windows; rushing / passagners don't see. -- #haiku
2) The plane has swept-back / falcon wings; my seat is near / the smelly toilet -- # haiku
3) Half gray, half golden a flock of little clouds scattered below me -- #haiku
And Merry Christmas / Happy Hanukkah / Joyous Solstice to all (and hope you had a good Buddha's birthday recently!)
Thanks for showing that "virtual community" is NOT an oxymoron, as I'd thought it was. I'll keep writing daily & post my best on my return.
Friends old & new: I'm heading off to two twitterless weeks visiting my folks. I have greatly enjoyed your company & your haiku.
